title: Geospatial Data Science with Julia
text:
Welcome
Geospatial Data Science with Julia provides a fresh approach to data science with geospatial data and the  programming language. It contains best practices for writting clean, readable and performant code in geoscientific applications involving sophisticated representations of the subsurface of the Earth such as unstructured meshes made of 2D and 3D geometries.
By reading this book, you will:

Get a broader perspective on geospatial data
Learn advanced geostatistical algorithms
Reproduce practical open-source examples

This online version of the book is hosted at geodatasciencewithjulia.org. and kept up-to-date by our open-source community.
This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-NonCommercial-NoDerivatives 4.0 International License.

title: 1  Introduction
text:
This is a book created from markdown and executable code.
See Knuth (1984) for additional discussion of literate programming.




Knuth, Donald E. 1984. “Literate Programming.” Comput. J. 27 (2): 97–111. https://doi.org/10.1093/comjnl/27.2.97.

title: 2  Summary
text: In summary, this book has no content whatsoever.

title: References
text:
